1.text: Select a high-quality extra virgin olive oil.

2.text: Infuse a single ingredient into the oil for a strong, bold flavor.

4.text: Do a cold-infusion for fresh herbs and organic ingredients.

5.text: Heat-infuse hardy herbs and preserved ingredients.

6.text: Wash and dry fresh herbs and organic ingredients.

7.text: Add your herbs to a food processor, and pulverize them for 30 seconds.

8.text: Place the herbs in the bottle and pour the oil on top.

9.text: Refrigerate the oil for 1-2 weeks to infuse the flavors.

10.text: Strain and re-bottle the oil when the flavor is strong enough.

11.text: Heat the oil in a medium saucepan to 150 °F (66 °C) and remove from heat.

12.text: Add woody herbs and preserved ingredients to the oil as it cools.

13.text: Strain the infused ingredients when the oil has cooled to room temperature.

14.text: Store heat-infused olive oil at room temperature or in the refrigerator.
